children.subject: If you want to make a proper argument, instead of posting on a forum whose moderators have no control over the issue, the Chancellor holds office hours: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfXKM1NYvWndD-KYGcZBnF2WHSG7vAPqMgH8nkXIc5aVTPlLg/viewform

What is the point of an add/drop deadline in week 4 if waitlists are purged week 2? 

What is the point of a waitlist if students can't wait?

What is the point of central campus administration if they suck?

I know it is frustrating that the EECS classes are impacted and cannot accept everyone who wants to enroll into a particular class. Please keep in mind that add/drop deadline spans many classes and not all wait lists are purged.

It may seem cruel to close classes and purge wait lists before the add/drop deadline but the intention behind doing so is to reflect the reality of the situation and encourage students to pursue other options before the add/drop deadline passes.

history.content:
Earlier today Prof. Paulos directed me to enroll the last few students into this class and to close enrollment. Part of that process included purging and closing the wait list for both CS 160 and CS 260A.

I have now taken all requested actions and have notified affected students via email.

For wait listed students who were purged, I regret any inconvenience this caused you. Each semester we do our best to accommodate as many students as possible but space and budget constraints limit what we can do. Please note that enrollment for other upper division classes is shifting so you may want to revisit classes.berkeley.edu to see which other upper division classes now have open seats.
history.subject: F18: CS 160/260A - Enrollment Closed
